Detailed Description

This concrete class represents the Newton method training algorithm for an objective functional of a multilayer perceptron.

See also:
TrainingAlgorithm.

Definition at line 32 of file NewtonMethod.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Flood::NewtonMethod::NewtonMethod ( ObjectiveFunctional *  newObjectiveFunctional  ) 

General constructor. It creates a Newton method training algorithm object associated to an objective functional object. It also initializes the class members to their default values:

Stopping criteria:

  • Evaluation goal: -1.0e99.
  • Gradient norm goal: 0.0.
  • Maximum training time: 1.0e6.
  • Maximum number of epochs: 100.

User stuff:

  • Display: true.
  • Display period: 25.

Parameters:
newObjectiveFunctional Pointer to an objective functional object.
See also:
TrainingAlgorithm.

Flood::NewtonMethod::NewtonMethod ( void   ) 

Default constructor. It creates a Newton method training algorithm object not associated to any objective functional object. It also initializes the class members to their default values:

Stopping criteria:

  • Evaluation goal: -1.0e99.
  • Gradient norm goal: 0.0.
  • Maximum training time: 1.0e6.
  • Maximum number of epochs: 100.

User stuff:

  • Display: true.
  • Display period: 25.

See also:
TrainingAlgorithm.

Member Function Documentation

void Flood::NewtonMethod::train ( void   )  [virtual]

This method trains a multilayer perceptron with an associated objective functional according to the Newton method algorithm. Training occurs according to the training parameters.

Implements Flood::TrainingAlgorithm.

void Flood::NewtonMethod::print ( void   )  [virtual]

This method prints to the screen the training parameters, the stopping criteria and other user stuff concerning the Newton's method object:

Stopping criteria:

  • Evaluation goal.
  • Gradient norm goal.
  • Maximum training time.
  • Maximum number of epochs.

User stuff:

  • Display.
  • Display period.

void Flood::NewtonMethod::load ( char *  filename  )  [virtual]

void Flood::NewtonMethod::resizeTrainingHistory ( int  newSize  ) 

This method resizes the vectors or matrices containing training history information to a new size:

  • Elapsed time history vector.
  • Free parameters history matrix.
  • Free parameters norm history vector.
  • Evaluation history vector.
  • Gradient history matrix.
  • Gradient norm history vector.
  • Training direction history matrix.
  • Training direction norm history vector
  • Training rate history vector.

Parameters:
newSize Size of training history.
